title: AC only cools when fan is set to ON
symptoms: System seems to cool a little when fan is ON constantly
When fan is set to AUTO, house gets warm
Outdoor unit may not start reliably
possible_causes: Low-voltage wiring problem between thermostat and air handler
recommended_actions: Confirm thermostat is set to COOL and fan to AUTO for normal operation
Reset thermostat to factory defaults if available
If outdoor unit does not start when COOL is called, have a technician check 24V control wiring and relays

title: Mini-split indoor head not responding
symptoms: Wall-mounted mini-split unit does not turn on
Remote control works with other units but not this one
Power light may blink a specific pattern
possible_causes: Local power supply issue at that indoor unit
recommended_actions: Reset unit by turning off breaker for 5 minutes then restoring power
Clean air filters and ensure nothing blocks condensate drain
Note any blinking pattern and check model manual or share with technician
If still dead, professional diagnostics of control board and communication wiring is required

title: Mini-split dripping water from indoor unit
symptoms: Water dripping from front of cassette or wall head
Condensation on casing
Happens more on very humid days
possible_causes: Clogged or kinked condensate drain line
Fan speed too low in extreme humidity
recommended_actions: Turn unit off and inspect drain outlet outside for blockage
Use wet/dry vacuum at drain outlet to clear sludge if accessible
Check with level tool if indoor unit slopes correctly toward drain
If leak persists, request service to inspect internal drain pan and line routing

title: Heat pump outdoor unit runs in cold weather but no heat
symptoms: Outdoor fan and compressor run in winter
Indoor air is cool or only slightly warm
Aux heat may not activate
possible_causes: Reversing valve stuck in cooling mode
Outdoor coil heavily iced and not defrosting properly
recommended_actions: Check thermostat mode is set to HEAT and configured as HEAT PUMP, not GAS/OIL
Inspect outdoor unit for thick ice buildup; if fully encased, turn system off and call for service
Technician should test reversing valve operation and defrost cycle

title: Heat pump runs on backup heat only
symptoms: Thermostat shows AUX HEAT or EM HEAT frequently
Energy bills much higher than usual
Outdoor unit may be idle while indoor electric strips or gas furnace runs
possible_causes: Outdoor unit locked out due to fault
Thermostat incorrectly set to EM HEAT
recommended_actions: Verify thermostat is not manually set to EM HEAT
Cycle breaker for outdoor unit off/on once if safe to attempt reset
If outdoor unit still does not run, schedule heat pump diagnostics; continuing on backup heat is expensive

title: AC blows dust and debris at startup
symptoms: Puff of dust from vents when system starts
More noticeable after long period of no use
Dust settles on furniture near vents
possible_causes: Old fiber duct liner shedding particles
recommended_actions: Ensure a high-quality filter is correctly installed with airflow arrow in proper direction
Vacuum supply registers and return grilles
Consider professional duct cleaning if dust is heavy or persistent
For old systems with fiber duct liner shedding, consult HVAC pro about lining repair or duct replacement

title: AC runs but thermostat display fluctuates wildly
symptoms: Room temperature reading jumps up and down quickly
AC turns on and off based on unstable reading
Thermostat near heat source or draft
possible_causes: Thermostat installed near supply vent or return grille
Direct sunlight or heat from electronics affecting sensor
recommended_actions: Move heat-generating devices away from thermostat
Ensure thermostat is not directly above air vent
If possible, relocate thermostat to interior wall away from doors and windows
If relocation not possible, consider a remote room sensor if supported by brand

title: AC stops after a few seconds of running
symptoms: Unit starts, runs briefly, then shuts off
Happens repeatedly, may click on and off
Breaker may eventually trip
possible_causes: Seized fan or compressor drawing high current
Severe low or high refrigerant pressure triggering safety switches
recommended_actions: Turn system off to avoid damage and overheating
Do not keep resetting breaker or thermostat
Schedule technician to check start capacitor, inrush current, and refrigerant pressures

title: Noisy whistling or roaring at return grille
symptoms: Very loud air noise at main return vent
Door slams or is hard to open when AC is running
You feel strong suction near return
possible_causes: Filter too restrictive or multiple filters installed
Closed interior doors creating pressure imbalance
recommended_actions: Open interior doors to improve air circulation
Use manufacturer-recommended filter MERV rating and avoid stacking filters
Discuss adding additional return grilles or duct resizing with HVAC contractor if noise and pressure are severe

title: Window AC unit leaking water indoors
symptoms: Water appears on windowsill or floor under window unit
Rear of unit may not drip water outside
Unit may appear tilted wrong direction
possible_causes: Drain channels or pan clogged with dirt
recommended_actions: Adjust installation so back of unit is slightly lower than front
Clean drain channels and weep holes with brush or compressed air
Clean or replace filter and coil to reduce icing
If water still flows inside, inspect for cracked drain pan

title: Window AC runs but only fan, no compressor
symptoms: Blows room-temperature air only
Fan speeds change but never cools
May hear click when compressor tries to start
possible_causes: Low refrigerant (non-serviceable in many small units)
recommended_actions: Set unit to coldest temperature and coldest mode and listen for compressor hum
If compressor never starts or trips breaker, unit likely needs professional repair or replacement
For small window units, replacement is often more economical than major sealed-system work

title: Portable AC exhaust very hot and room still warm
symptoms: Hose behind portable AC is extremely hot
Room does not cool much
Hot air leaks around window panel
possible_causes: Exhaust hose too long or kinked
Poor sealing at window kit allowing hot outdoor air in
recommended_actions: Use shortest possible exhaust hose and avoid sharp bends
Seal window gaps carefully with foam or weather-strip
Close curtains and unused rooms to reduce load
Confirm BTU rating is appropriate for room size; if not, consider larger unit

title: AC system noisy only in attic or crawlspace
symptoms: You hear booming, rattling, or flapping sounds in attic
Indoor noise in rooms is mild but above ceiling is loud
Ducts visibly move when system starts
possible_causes: Loose sheet metal in plenum or trunks
Backdraft damper or zone damper slamming shut
recommended_actions: Have HVAC technician inspect duct supports and secure loose metal with proper fasteners
Consider adding acoustic insulation around very noisy trunk sections
If zoning system exists, verify dampers are operating smoothly and not slamming

title: AC thermostat loses time or schedule after power outages
symptoms: Programmed schedule resets randomly
Clock on thermostat wrong after brief power cut
Older digital thermostat model
recommended_actions: Replace thermostat batteries if model uses them
If model is very old, consider upgrading to modern smart or programmable thermostat with memory
Install small UPS for furnace/air handler control if power is very unstable (done by professional)

title: AC coils corroding near coastal area
symptoms: Fins on outdoor unit flaking or crumbling
Frequent refrigerant leaks at coils
System performance declines over a few years
possible_causes: Industrial pollutants attacking aluminum and copper
Unit not rated for coastal environment
recommended_actions: Rinse outdoor unit gently with fresh water occasionally to remove salt (with power off)
Consider coil coating options recommended by manufacturer or HVAC pro
When replacing unit, choose coastal-rated equipment with protective coatings

title: AC refrigerant lines sweating excessively indoors
symptoms: Copper lines inside home dripping on ceiling or wall
Insulation on suction line missing or damaged
Moisture stains around line-set penetration
recommended_actions: Have suction line re-insulated with closed-cell insulation along full exposed length
Seal wall penetrations with appropriate foam or sealant to stop air leaks
Run dehumidifier if indoor humidity is consistently high

title: Condensate pump for AC keeps running or buzzing
symptoms: Small pump near air handler cycles frequently or runs nonstop
Clicking or buzzing noise from pump
AC may shut off when pump fails
recommended_actions: Unplug system and pump before inspecting
Check discharge tubing for clogs or kinks and clear them
Clean pump reservoir and float mechanism
Replace pump if it overheats, leaks, or cannot empty water

title: AC unit very old and using R-22 refrigerant
symptoms: System older than 15–20 years
Service label shows R-22
Repairs and refrigerant top-ups very expensive
possible_causes: Aged compressor and coils with multiple leaks
Inefficient design compared to modern units
recommended_actions: Avoid investing large amount of money into repeated R-22 refills
Plan for system replacement with modern R-410A or R-32 equipment when major leak or compressor failure occurs
Prioritize energy-efficient models with higher SEER ratings

title: AC duct sweat causing ceiling stains
symptoms: Water stains or mold spots around supply vents
Cold metal trunk or boots sweating in attic
Occurs more on humid days
possible_causes: Ducts or boots uninsulated or poorly insulated
Warm, humid attic air contacting cold metal
recommended_actions: Add or repair insulation around cold ducts in unconditioned spaces
Seal around ceiling boots with foam or caulk
Use dehumidification or ventilation to reduce attic humidity if excessive

title: Zone system: one zone not cooling
symptoms: Multi-zone system where one thermostat works and another does not
Some dampers stuck open or closed
Temperature imbalance between zones
possible_causes: Thermostat for that zone miswired or dead
recommended_actions: Verify the zone thermostat has power and display
Listen near ducts for damper movement when changing setpoint
Have technician test zone board outputs and damper actuators
Do not force dampers open by hand; this can break gears

title: AC smells like gas or chemical refrigerant
symptoms: Sharp chemical odor near indoor or outdoor unit
Hissing sound from coil or line set
Possible oily residue near connection
recommended_actions: Turn system off and ventilate area if odor is strong
Avoid open flames or smoking near suspected leak
Call licensed HVAC technician immediately for leak detection and repair
Do not attempt to handle refrigerant yourself

title: AC trips GFCI or AFCI outlet/breaker
symptoms: Outdoor unit powered through GFCI outlet trips often
Breaker with arc-fault protection trips when AC starts
No obvious system fault visible
possible_causes: Nuisance trip due to motor inrush current and electronics
Actual ground fault in wiring or compressor
Improperly selected breaker type for HVAC equipment
recommended_actions: Do not bypass safety without professional advice
Have electrician or HVAC pro check wiring insulation and equipment grounding
Consult local electrical code; some HVAC circuits must use standard breakers, not GFCI/AFCI, unless required by code

title: Heat pump defrost cycle seems abnormal
symptoms: Outdoor unit makes swooshing or whooshing sound in winter
Steam rises from outdoor unit
Indoor air may briefly cool during defrost
possible_causes: Normal defrost operation misunderstood by homeowner
Defrost cycle too frequent or too long
recommended_actions: Know that short defrost cycles with steam release can be normal on cold, damp days
If unit spends more time in defrost than heating, have technician check defrost board and sensors
Verify outdoor coil is not constantly iced over between cycles

title: AC air handler very loud in closet
symptoms: Closet door vibrates and rattles
Return air sound is strong and annoying
System otherwise cools fine
possible_causes: Closet door too thin and unsealed
recommended_actions: Upgrade return grille size if possible to reduce noise and static pressure
Weather-strip closet door and consider solid-core door for sound reduction
Add acoustic panels or insulation around closet (while keeping clearances and service access)

title: AC starts with a loud metal clang indoors
symptoms: Short metal clang at start-up from air handler area
Then normal operation
Sound may be from duct or damper
possible_causes: Filter rack or access door slapping closed
recommended_actions: Verify access panels and filter door are securely latched
Add foam gasketing where metal meets metal to cushion impact
Ask technician to inspect internal components during maintenance visit

title: AC seems to cool but thermostat reading incorrect
symptoms: Space feels comfortable but thermostat displays wrong temperature
Difference of 2–5°C from another thermometer
System may cycle oddly
possible_causes: Drafts or radiant heat affecting thermostat
recommended_actions: Compare thermostat reading with a reliable room thermometer
If offset is consistent, some thermostats allow calibration/offset setting
If no calibration available, consider replacing with a higher-quality model

title: Ductless mini-split fan never stops even when set temperature reached
symptoms: Indoor fan runs continuously at low speed
Room remains at set temperature
Outdoor unit cycles normally
possible_causes: Normal operation mode for many inverter systems
Fan mode set to continuous instead of auto
User expectation different from central AC behavior
recommended_actions: Check remote control for fan mode; set to AUTO if available
Understand that some inverter systems keep fan running to maintain even temperature and sense room conditions
If airflow is annoying, reduce fan speed or use quiet mode if supported

title: AC control board shows blinking LED error
symptoms: Small LED on indoor or outdoor PCB blinks in pattern
System may not start or may lock out
Manual often required to decode pattern
recommended_actions: Count blink pattern (e.g., 3 short, 1 long) and photograph it
Check unit label or manual for diagnostic chart
Share code and brand/model with HVAC technician for targeted troubleshooting

title: AC causes lights to dim briefly at startup
symptoms: House lights flicker or dim when compressor starts
More noticeable on older homes
No breakers trip
possible_causes: Normal inrush current of compressor on weak electrical service
Loose neutral or connections in panel
Oversized AC on marginal service capacity
recommended_actions: Have licensed electrician inspect service connections and panel for loose lugs or undersized wiring
Ask HVAC pro about soft-start kits or inverter-based replacement when upgrading system
If dimming is severe or prolonged, treat as electrical safety issue

title: AC system frequently needs refrigerant added
symptoms: Technician has added refrigerant multiple times in past years
Cooling improves for a while then declines again
Icing or warm-air symptoms return seasonally
possible_causes: Persistent refrigerant leak not properly found and repaired
Improper past repair leaving small leaks
recommended_actions: Understand that refrigerant is not a consumable; repeated refills indicate a leak
Request full leak search using electronic detector and/or dye testing
If coils are badly corroded, plan for coil or system replacement rather than endless refills
Avoid operating unit with low refrigerant to protect compressor
